page.title: 16June 1985
page.content: During the month of June 1985 there were the usual monthly meetings of the Lavenham Parish Council and the Women's Institute.The local Salvation Army held their Annual Summer Fete in the garden of the Manor House.June 14th-18th saw the visit of the descendants of the SPRYNG family.They came from all parts of the world,but chiefly from Australia.The famous SPRYNG family were wealthy weavers and clothiers in Lavenham in the 15th century and were very much involved with the building of Lavenham Church. Work on the present building started in 1485.Local Church members took the visitors round the village and provided lunches and teas.At the close of the visit there was an Eucharist of Thanksgiving in the Parish Church with an attendance of approximately 250.
